block.p: Kyle Lee Miscia, a daughter of Lucille Miscia and Dr. Vincent F. Miscia of Bridgewater, Conn., was married yesterday to David Morris Clark, the son of Patricia Clark and Dr. Morris Clark of Roxbury, Conn. The Rev. Thomas Bennett, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Church in Washington, Conn.

Mrs. Clark, 30, is the public relations manager and employment recruiter in New York for SF Interactive, an online-marketing company. She graduated magna cum laude from Georgetown University. Her father, a retired cardiologist, was the chief of staff at Midlands Community Hospital in Papillion, Neb., and the surgeon for the Nebraska Army National Guard in Lincoln.

Kyle Lee Miscia, a daughter of Lucille Miscia and Dr. Vincent F. Miscia of Bridgewater, Conn., was married yesterday to David Morris Clark, the son of Patricia Clark and Dr. Morris Clark of Roxbury, Conn. The Rev. Thomas Bennett, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Church in Washington, Conn.

Mrs. Clark, 30, is the public relations manager and employment recruiter in New York for SF Interactive, an online-marketing company. She graduated magna cum laude from Georgetown University. Her father, a retired cardiologist, was the chief of staff at Midlands Community Hospital in Papillion, Neb., and the surgeon for the Nebraska Army National Guard in Lincoln.

Mr. Clark, 30, is a founder and the vice president for business development of Shanah Inc., a New York company that provides intranet services to retirement communities. He graduated from Tulane University. His parents work in New Milford, Conn. His mother is the director of the American Red Cross chapter there. His father, an internist, is a partner in New Milford Internal Medical Associates.
